Indeed, finding a balance that benefits everyone can be challenging because different stakeholders have different interests and needs. There will always be trade-offs, and policymakers must weigh the potential costs and benefits of regulatory regimes.

Ultimately, policymakers must consider the objectives of the regulatory regime and determine the best approach to meet those objectives. For example, the objective of telecommunications regulation could be to promote competition, improve service quality, or protect consumers. The chosen approach will have to consider the potential costs to businesses and consumers as well as the potential long-term benefits of the regulation.

In summary, policymakers face the challenge of balancing the interests of various stakeholders while ensuring that regulatory goals are achieved.
